14.2.2 Calcium
Low calcium intake during pregnancy may negatively influence bone mineral content in children and peak 
bone mass in early adulthood [11,32]. In addition, fetal calcium deficiency has been associated with low 
birth weight [33] and high blood pressure in adult offspring [7]. Moreover, evidence suggests that calcium 
supplementation during pregnancy
